Array: My name is Nana Ogasawara. I'm a seventh-grader at
Musashigawa Girls' Middle School.
And I can't help but wonder, why did this happen
to us?
I was just playing around with some drama club
friends and some high school kids after class...
...when suddenly, everything went white, and we
found ourselves trapped in here!
And by we, I mean me, my friend Chihaya Yamase from
homeroom, and an old friend from another class,
Nari Amatoya, whom I've known practically forever.
Those two were the only ones in the room with me
when I came to. I'm not sure what happened to the
others.
A rep from another class, Hikari Kirigami, and two
high-schoolers named Naruse and Kazane were with us
before, but are nowhere to be found now.
So Chihaya, Nari and I have been wandering these
halls aimlessly for quite some time in search of
them.
Chihaya was the first to brave using the bathroom,
and even went in alone...but came running out not a
moment later, claiming to have heard a scary voice.
During her flight, it seems she dropped the pouch
she always carries with her...and I've agreed to
go in and find it in her place.
Vast quantities of medicine and tonics are lined up
on each of the shelves.
There's a pair of scissors on one of the shelves,
both its blades covered liberally in blood.
There's an open journal and a framed picture on the
desk.
The journal seems almost decorative, as if it were
a plastic model built into the desk. No part of it
can be moved even the slightest bit.
There's an open journal and a framed picture on the
desk.
The journal seems almost decorative, as if it were
a plastic model built into the desk. No part of it
can be moved even the slightest bit.
The handle turns with a loud squeak, but not a drop
of water comes out.
There's an anatomical diagram of the human body
tacked to the wall.
Somehow, its eyes seem as if they're watching your
every move...
It's an old-fashioned space heater.
Unfortunately, it's so full of ash that it'll
probably never light again.
It's an old-fashioned space heater.
Unfortunately, it's so full of ash that it'll
probably never light again.
Vast quantities of medicine and tonics are lined up
on each of the shelves.
[A Guide To Feeling Despair]
--It's easy!--
Yes, it really is as simple as you'd think.
No problem at all. Even a child can do it!
What is there to explain?
Just feel it, and there you are!
But what if you want to STOP feeling it?
Well, now, that's the tricky part...
Aha! It's a hat!
There's a felt hat on the ground that seems to
radiate an air of luxury and refinement. Take it?
Tak
Nie
Acquired [Felt Hat].
Chihaya...?
I'm tired...
I hate this. *sob* *sob*
I want to go home...
Chihaya...
It's okay. We'll get out of here. I know we will!
How can you even say that?
What possible reason could you have for believing...
that we'll ever be able to leave this place?
Chihaya...
Are you saying I can hold you responsible...if we
never get home again?
Chihaya! That's enough!
I've had about all I can take of your whining!
We're not in the safety of our own familiar little
world anymore. People aren't going to bend over
backwards to spare your feelings here!
We're fighting for survival! It's every girl for
herself!
So don't think for a minute that we're going to
stop and console you every time you have a damsel
in distress moment, just because we're your friends!
Waaaaaaaaaahhhh!!
Eyaaaaaaaaaahh!!
Go ahead and cry! See if I care!
Nari, that was totally uncalled for.
Not everybody's as strong-willed as you, you know.
Fine. Do whatever the hell you want, then!
*sniffle*
There's a message scribbled on the wall:
'Try the stall to the right.'
Is it...a gh-ghost...?
This room does give me the creeps, but I promised
Chihaya I'd find her pouch. I can't leave without
it.
Aha! Found it!
There's a pink, plastic pouch on the ground.
Pick it up?
Tak
Nie
Acquired [Chihaya's Pouch].
Most impressive. You found what you were looking
for, without searching my stall. People have been
barging in on me a lot lately, you see.
I've been getting rather uppity with the living
for always shamelessly opening the door with
reckless abandon, as your comrade did a moment ago.
See, I'm quite easily frightened, as it happens. The
only place where I feel truly safe and at home is in
this restroom stall.
(It's strange... I can't explain why...)
(...but I don't find this person scary at all...
even though he's clearly a ghost...)
Hmm...
As the spirit sways from side to side, the faint
blue light radiating from his body twinkles
throughout the room.
You are too kind...
Offered [Superstar Sunglasses] to the spirit.
*disgusted sigh*
The spirit stuck out his lower lip and shook his
head quite fervently.
Seems he doesn't much care for them.
Guess they're not his after all. Unsurprisingly.
Offered [Distinguished Glasses] to the spirit.
You have my eternal gratitude. I have always felt
that these glasses existed in this world solely to
be worn by me. Oh, how I missed them...
They look really good on you.
I guess all that's left now is to find your hat,
right?
You are too kind...
You are too kind...
The mirror's so cloudy, you really can't make
anything out.
This mirror is perfectly clear, but only your own
pallid face stares back at you.
A strong stench hangs over the urinal.
For goodness' sake, Chihaya... This is clearly the
boys' room!
Nana?
Eeek!
...Oh, it's you. Don't scare me like that!
Sorry. You've just been in here for a while, so I
was getting a little worried. Is everything all
right?
Y-Yeah, everything's fine. Thanks, though.
Great. I'll stay with Chihaya, then, and you finish
what you're doing. But please, if you can, hurry
it up.
A child's bloody handprint is clearly visible on
the glass.
SHUT THE GODDAMNED DOOR!!
EEK!!
Wh-Who the heck was that?!
That was definitely a voice!
...I have no means of being exorcised from this
place, of course. So this is as close to a home
as I can find.
Ahhh... Be it ever so humble...
Ahhh... Be it ever so humble...
*sigh*
It's really true...
He's not scary at all...
If I may, I have a favor to ask of you three. Some
rogue fiend has absconded with my prized gentleman's
set.
By which I mean, my hat and my glasses.
If you should happen upon them in your wanderings,
would you be so kind as to return them to me?
Sure thing!
Uh...no?
So your possessions have been stolen, then?
That's terrible...
Wait here. We'll find them.
You are too kind...
I...don't think that's a good idea...
I read in a book once that if you should heed the
requests of the dead, you'll soon follow them into
death yourself.
Remembering those words suddenly filled me with
dread. I knew we had to get out of that room...so
I turned tail and ran.
The others weren't far behind. After we caught our
breath, we began wandering the darkened halls of
the abandoned school building once again.
Naruse... Kazane... Hikari... Our missing friends.
We called their names over and over again as we
walked.
But our voices just seemed to be absorbed by the
darkness in front of our faces, where they melted
away into nothingness.
We knew that eventually, those voices would give out
altogether, and our bodies would cease to function.
It was only a matter of time.
But despite that inevitability, we decided then and
there that we would keep on walking, for as long as
it took.
We couldn't give up. We had to continue struggling
against our fate, calling out into the darkness with
whatever voices we had left...
...for as long as we lived...
You have my thanks once again. I've always cherished
this hat, you see. It was specially selected for me
by Tanaka...one of my most beloved subordinates.
I'm so glad we were able to find it. It seems like
it means a lot to you, and it just feels really good
to help someone in need.
Doesn't it?
Się wie.
You are truly benevolent souls. My eternal gratitude
is yours.
You possess such clear eyes and pure hearts...
If I still lived, I would use the rest of my days
to offer you protection and guidance.
I shan't lose these items again. And I should hope
that you not lose the generosity you've shown...for
this place can quickly and easily crush the spirit.
In times like this, especially, it is important that
you not succumb to despair, nor forsake your true
nature.
Rather, you should scoff in despair's rotund face,
and embrace who you are. You should love yourselves!
But now, I must bid adieu, for my home is calling to
me. I pray that you three, as well, will find your
way back to your own homes in due time.
Fare thee well!
I LOVE YOU!
Although still apprehensive about our surroundings,
we felt slightly better having done a good deed, and
held our heads high as we exited the bathroom.
From there, we began wandering the darkened halls of
the abandoned school building once again.
Naruse... Kazane... Hikari... Our missing friends.
We called their names over and over again as we
walked.
But our voices just seemed to be absorbed by the
darkness in front of our faces, where they melted
away into nothingness.
We knew that eventually, those voices would give out
altogether, and our bodies would cease to function.
It was only a matter of time.
But despite that inevitability, we decided then and
there that we would keep on walking, for as long as
it took.
We couldn't give up. We had to continue struggling
against our fate, calling out into the darkness with
whatever voices we had left...
...for as long as we lived...
Heehee. He's a pretty fun person, huh.
'Too far. Go back one.'
'One more over.'
There's a pair of sunglasses in the stall with
star-shaped lenses.
Take them.
Back away slowly.
Acquired [Superstar Sunglasses].
I think...it would be really hard to look good in
these.
'One more over.'
A strange force seems to be repelling you.
You cannot progress beyond this point.
A strange force seems to be repelling you.
You cannot progress beyond this point.
A strange force seems to be repelling you.
You cannot progress beyond this point.
Seems like it could be crossed, with some effort...
A strange force seems to be repelling you.
You cannot progress beyond this point.
A strange force seems to be repelling you.
You cannot progress beyond this point.
A strange force seems to be repelling you.

You cannot progress beyond this point.
A strange force seems to be repelling you.
You cannot progress beyond this point.
A strange force seems to be repelling you.
You cannot progress beyond this point.
The countdown has begun. You'd better hurry!
Hurry scurry!
*wince* *moan* *sigh*
My leg really hurts, Nana...
Oh, my! Chihaya, I think you need to rest for a bit.
*weep* ...This is too much for me...
The two guys to the north of me are both telling the
truth. You should believe everything they say.
And you should also return to the third floor right
away, without exploring anywhere else beforehand.
[Science Lab]
The door seems affixed to the wall like a model.
It can't be opened.
[Infirmary]
The door is locked.
[Infirmary]
The door is locked.
Use the [Infirmary Key]?
Tak
Nie
The guy to the south is a liar. You mustn't believe
a word he says.
The guy to the west is a liar. You mustn't believe
a word he says.
The loose board has gotten itself wedged in the gap
rather tightly. It won't come out.
A strange force seems to be repelling you.
You cannot progress beyond this point.
Nana...
Chihaya! I found it! Here.
Handed over [Chihaya's Pouch].
Yay! Thank you!
You know, though...when you drop something,
shouldn't YOU be the one to go look for it?
Nari...
*sniffle* *sniffle*
Don't cry, Chihaya. There's nothing scary in there.
In fact, quite the opposite. There IS actually
a ghost...but he's friendly, and he even talked
to me!
You serious? Isn't that, like, dangerous?!
No, it's totally fine! He seemed like a really
nice person. I don't suppose...you'd want to
meet him yourselves, would you?
Whaa...?!
I think...I would.
After all, we've been here for several hours now,
and there hasn't been anyone else to talk to this
whole time.
The three of us began wandering the darkened halls
of the abandoned school building once again.
Naruse... Kazane... Hikari... Our missing friends.
We called their names over and over again as we
walked.
But our voices just seemed to be absorbed by the
darkness in front of our faces, where they melted
away into nothingness.
We knew that eventually, those voices would give out
altogether, and our bodies would cease to function.
It was only a matter of time.
But despite that inevitability, we decided then and
there that we would keep on walking, for as long as
it took.
We couldn't give up. We had to continue struggling
against our fate, calling out into the darkness with
whatever voices we had left...
...for as long as we lived...
[WRONG END]
Looks like our noble party of adventurers has
accepted a quest. Let's give it everything
we've got!
Right-o!
This is so ridiculous...
[WRONG END]
Oww! ...That smarts...
[Warning: Your HP is getting low!]
Looking for something? I'm sure you won't find it
downstairs anywhere...
Find what you were looking for?
The spirit that started on the bottom right does
NOT have an item you'd want.
Find what you were looking for?
No touch the pretty key! It's my precccciousss...
The spirit is holding a key marked 'Infirmary.'
Yank it away from him?
Tak
Nie
Acquired [Infirmary Key].
A strange force seems to be repelling you.
You cannot progress beyond this point.
[Lavatories]
<-- Girls     Boys -->
Let's keep our restrooms clean!
Beware the lies of the red spirits...
There's a pair of distinguished-looking glasses
sitting on the bannister. Take them?
Tak
Nie
Acquired [Distinguished Glasses].
The item you seek is DOWNSTAIRS.
Need help finding it?
Try talking to the MOVING SPIRITS.
